article:
:For the pilot episode of the "Seinfeld" series itself, see'The Seinfeld
Chronicles'. {{Infobox Television episode
| Title = The Pilot Series = Seinfeld Season = 4 Episode = 23/24 Airdate = May
| 20, 1993 Production = 423/424 Writer = Larry David Director = Tom Cherones
| Guests = Bob Balaban as Russell  Anne Twomey as Rita  Gina Hecht as
| Dana Foley  Peter Crombie as Joe Davola  Jeremy Piven as Michael Barth
| (George)  Larry Hankin as Tom Pepper (Kramer)  Kevin Page as Stu 
| Mariska Hargitay as Melissa  Laura Waterbury as Casting Director 
| Elena Wohl as Sandi Robbins (Elaine)  Bruce Jarchow as Doctor  Al
| Ruscio as Manager  Richard Gant as Fred Episode list = List of
| ''Seinfeld'' episodes Season list = Prev = Next =
}} "'The Pilot'" is the two-part season finale episode of the fourth season
of [[Seinfeld]]. It makes up the 63rd and 64th episodes and first aired on
May 20, 1993.

This two-part episode aired at an earlier time, 8:00 PM, to make room for the
two-hour finale of [[Cheers]], whose timeslot would be claimed by Seinfeld at
the start of the new fall season. Approximately 32 million watched this episode
(both parts) when it initially aired, and the show became a major ratings grab
for its next five seasons. Airing before the final episode of [[Cheers]], it
drew its highest ratings ever (to be later surpassed by The Finale).
